title: Why are people saying that Mike Shinoda of Linkin Park “knows what he did and he’ll pay for it” in regards to Chester Bennington’s death? - Quora

response.answer_text: I haven’t been much active on social media, but I think I know the story behind this. First, let me tell you a little back-story.  In 1996, three high school friends, Mike Shinoda, Bradford Delson and Rob Bourden, came together to create a band called Xero, along with Dave Farrell, Joe Hahn and Mark Wakefield. The band, alas, did not gain much prominence and Mark Wakefield left the band. Now, searching for a replacement, they recruited a vocalist from Arizona named Chester Bennington, who replaced Mike as the band’s front-man when they changed their name to Hybrid Theory and later to Linkin Park in 2000.  Now fast forward to 20th July 2017. After a widely successful career and a huge cult following, Chester Bennington committed suicide in his Paolos Verdes Estates home in California. A known patient of depression, he took his life by hanging. Merely 2–3 days later, the Twitter account of his wife, Talinda Bennington, released a statement saying that she was cheating on him with fellow-bandmate Mike and that she never loved him, just his money.   While the account was proven to be hacked, this refueled a rumour from long back that Mike was not happy with Chester having taken his place as the lead in the band and held a grudge against him. People also believed that Mike knew about his depression, yet never did anything to cure it. What I would like to say is that fans have been so blinded by Chester, that they ignored the amazing chemistry he and Mike had, both on-stage and off-stage. This is all just rumours and Mike had nothing to do with it. Peace Out!
